review: I use Vortioxetine to treat my Depression. I have CPTSD from traumatic experiences and neglect while growing up and I have tried plenty of other medications (Prozac did less than nothing for me and Lexapro made me an emotional zombie) and this medication is the only one that has helped get me the strength I need to get out of this depression.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):On Trintellix for 3 months for  GAD. Not a fun time on this stuff. It constipated me so bad, it sent me to the hospital twice for diverticulitis (and I had no prior history of this). Once I stopped taking this drug I went back to normal.  Did not work for my anxiety/depression at all, made me feel dialled into the wrong radio station. Worked all the way up to 15mg, doctor tried to get me on 20mg, told her to get me off this stuff and switch me to something different! I asked her many times to switch, to which she said "you have to give it time to work!". Listen, if you try it out and you feel it's not going to work, make sure you ask to be switched and be firm!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Trintellix has been amazing for me. I’ve never been put on a drug that made me feel this much better this fast. My suicidality was through the roof a week before I was prescribed. 2 weeks after beginning Trintellix, my suicidality is gone and my mood hasn’t been this bright in years.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I have severe PTSD and major depression.  I have tried multiple medications and all of them had horrible side effects.  I started taking 10 mg at the end of November 2021.  So far my depression has improved significantly with no side effects at this time.  I had a little nausea and dizziness the first two weeks.  Side note this medication has caused the least sexual side effects.  Libido has been average but I am able to have ejaculations which was not possible on the other meds.   So far this has been a good medication for me.

I've had problems with severe depression and anxiety for a couple years now it got to the point where I took months off work, fast forward to now am on 10mg vortioxetine and have been for 6 months. I am the best I’ve ever been but it wasn’t a straight road you have to meet these things halfway and be patient. I didn’t want to do these things but I highly recommend doing gym work, exercise and eating right because it really makes the difference. It took me a 2-3 months to really get back to myself. I also recommend vitamins etc also try your best to avoid alcohol it doesn’t help things

I'm now 3 Months on Trintellix 20 mg and take also 60 mg Ritalin per Day. I have been suffering though my childhood from really severe ADHD and other comorbidities. I'm 51 Year old and finally I found the 2 Medicines of my life that work synergistically work  and are both absolutely amazing medicine and the result is PERFECT. If You suffer from ADHD or Depressions aka both , try Trintellix with your ADHD Medicine and see the Results. I love Love Ritalin and Trintellix so Much.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Doctors must be getting a kickback to push this drug as the latest and greatest.  DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG.  The side effects were horrific but most of all--I went from being extremely depressed and turned into the Incredible Hulk.  And I'm not talking about the new mamby-pamby Incredible Hulk, I am talking full-on Lou Ferrigno Incredible Hulk.  It did NOTHING For the depression.  At the same time, my husband's closest coworker was on trintellix, as well, so my poor husband was getting ripped to shreds at home AND at work.  DO NOT SEEK THIS TREASURE.  JUST SAY NO to TRINTELLIX.

Great drug .. I sleep better , my moods are better but there is one side effect that is making me want to stop that , the nausea , sometimes making me vomit almost everyday.Also I have become a very gagging individual which I have never been before. Taken it for over 8 weeks ... still get waves of sickness .

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Trintellix saved my life from living a nightmare of anxiety. 10 mg dose. My thought process is better, my sleep is better, racing thoughts have improved. My brain is able to process things a lot better. I don't have the feeling of not being able to breathe or a heaviness on my chest. Side effects are easy to cope with! I rarely have any, if I have any they aren't noticeable.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I noticed positive effects on my bi polar 2 on the lowest dose of 5mg's. It lifted my depression and mood to a more positive motivated and functional one with in just a few days! I have had no side effects except weight gain but this could be due to another med I'm taking.The downside. For the positive effects didn't last and my Dr. increased me up to the highest dose gradually with the same results. Only a short term increase in mood. I'm now on 20 mg's.For me the medication seems to peak then I  level out to a just a sub par result but definitely better with the med than without it.As far as side effects. So far the best antidepressant I've taken in regards to no side effects.It is somewhat expensive since it's brand name only at this time.Probably better than taking nothing.

Been on vortioxetine now for only 4 Days.  I know that I will take at least 8 weeks before I see any response for it.  I have been told by others on it that it's a great antidepressant for them, but everyone is different so I'll be back on here to tell you all if it works for me or not fingers crossed it works.
I took it for anxiety and depression. Went all the way up to 20 mg/day. It did not help and made me nauseous and itchy.

Hi guys, I had severe depression episode and doctor prescribed me this medicament. First 2 weeks, I felt a lot better. But on third everything everything was the opposite. This medicine showed us that I am bi-polar and I went to hypomania pretty fast. I am experiencing hypomania already for 4th week.That being said, be careful with this medicine.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):It took years for me to find the right medication. I have GAD/PTSD, and have been on every antidepressant you can think of. This is the only medication that has worked for me! I felt relief the first week! The side effects for me were minimal, just a little bit of nausea that went away 4 days later. I nibbled on some crackers with peanut butter and that took the ickiness away. Make sure to drink plenty of water when on this medication, it can leave you with a little dryness in your mouth.  I am so happy, because this medication makes me feel normal! I can focus, the depression is gone, and the anxiety is not an issue for me now. I am so grateful! I can be me again!!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I had the most strange experience with this med. It gave me such severe diarrhea that I ended up with hemorrhoids. The hemorrhoids then became so severe that I had a rectal banding procedure. At the time, I had no idea that the med was causing this. The rectal banding ulcerated, and I ended up hospitalized to have the banding removed. It took forever to heal until I put 2 and 2 together and got off the Trintellix. Once off, I healed very quickly.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I had sexual dysfunction with every other anti depressant I ever tried, which made me not want to use SSRIs. My doctor put me on Trintellix for crippling depression and anxiety. I had felt so bad every single day. I had absolutely no hope for the future. Trintellix has changed my life. I feel so much better. I don’t even feel like the same person anymore. I have hope and it feels like a massive weight has been lifted off my shoulders. I have NO side effects from this medication. I am so thankful!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I started the first two weeks on 5mg and it wasn’t good because of the side effects (nausea, sweating, difficulty concentrating, etc.). BUT once I passed that part, the side effects were barely noticeable. I increased the dosage to 10mg and it’s the right dosage for me. The medication really helps my mood and I’m more able to see the bright side of a situation than ever before. I feel more calm and happy and I got my motivation back. It’s not a miracle pill I had to work on myself (do sport, see some friends, making projects, etc.), but in my case I can tell with no doubts that medication really helps me after fews weeks (4-5 weeks). Plus, I had no problem with alcohol consumption (moderate) and It has zero effect on my libido and weight gain, which is truly amazing for me.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):First 15 days nausea for an hour or two.Nearly 2 months now and am still depressed with little energy. Depression at its worst on waking in the morning.  Often feel tearful then.Would only score this medication a 4/10, however haven't gained weight, but my doctor said it was weight neutral. Don't want to increase my dosage.  Would rather try another antidepressant. Also concerned about low sodium, which can be a side effect.

I switched to Brintellix after anorgasmia caused by Lexapro. Lexapro worked wonders, otherwise. Brintellix is, in my experience, a much lighter antidepressant than SSRIs. I can still have lows that are low, but they last really short. So what it basically does for me, is that I recover much quicker. I take 20mg, before 20 I could not feel any effect. I would recommend this to someone that has a mild depression, not something tougher. IMPORTANT: I was an ambitious and high functioning person before developing depression and anxiety. Lexapro made me a bit lazy, I was content doing nothing and changing nothing. Brintellix re-balanced me more towards what I used to be, I can work long hours without freaking out now. The only side effect is that I sleep incredibly long hours (average 9-10h per night) vs 6-7 of the past.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):64yo F w Multiple Sclerosis, depression/anxiety. 18 yrs on Effexor/Wellbutrin. Never great, but OK.January 2021 dep/anx worsened. Tried Remeron, Lexapro, WellbutrinXR, Buspirone and Vybriid.Epic fails!Trintellix 2.5 mg September 2021. Raised dose slowly to avoid side effects. Lorazepam 0.25mg 3-4 times/day for anxiety Trintellix made worse.Ate oatmeal, cottage cheese, protein shake, toast & jam - before Trintellix each morning.No nausea. Just bad Headache!Increased Trintellix to 5 mg/day. Then to 7 1/2 mg.Headache increased & developed  increasingly blurry vision and worsening constipation.After 11 days of 7 1/2 mg, BP 170/110, pulse 90s, agitated and suicidal. Stopped Trintellix.

Male here aged 47, long term depression sufferer. For around 20 years I was using the more usual meds for depression, all the usual SSRI family.  I did find some success with them in the earlier days but over the previous years they were no longer effective and also I was always feeling tired sleepy all day, which became unacceptable for me.  I switched to vortioxetine and its been excellent, it feels more effective than all those previous meds, and it doesn't make me feel sleepy.  I'm taking 10mg and the only side effect  got during the first month of taking it was, my restless legs syndrome worsened, but that's passed now and I'm back to fine again.  I recommend trying this med to anyone who is no longer having luck with all the other usual SSRI meds. it works very well for some people and I seem to be one of them. I'm really glad my doctor prescribed it!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):This is the worst drug any big pharma could ever put on the market.  I'm a 52 yr old women who tried this for light depression and anxiety. My dr. gave me FREE trials. Oh dear god this drug must be taken off the market.  It gave me severe increased ANXIETY I almost went out of my mind. I had a very heavy head feeling and terrible uneasy feeling for days. My heart was racing and had increased pain and heaviness in it just horrendous.take this drug off the market , couldn't imagine any young adult going through this with this particular medication it would be horrifying for them...any company that gives free samples of medicine should be held responsible for there terrible trial runs using people as guinea pigs!!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):First day taking Trintellix 5mg. My anxiety is 1,000X worse in just a few hours. Completely exhausted but I've been rolling around in bed for hours kicking at the sheets. Headache. Weird tension.This is a terrible drug. I won't be taking any further doses.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Took the full 8 weeks to adjust with a lot of stomach upset at first, but it gradually  took away my anxiety which was making it hard to function. I was much better but still had some depressive thoughts/early waking (minus anxiety) - Doc explained 10mg treats anxiety, 15mg makes no difference and 20mg will treat the depression. So after a while I opted to level up and got some adjustment turbulence again for a couple of weeks - then I was all good. Much much better. Living life in a calmer and more constructive way. None of the sexual dysfunction side effects I got from escitalopram (lexapro - which was great for me othersiwe.) I swore I’d come back and review as I relied so heavily on reading these while I was waiting for relief. I won’t be putting myself back out in the cold with no meds ever again, it’s not pretty.

I have HOCD  and I tried a lot of SSRIs and had very bad side effects with them all. I started by taking a 5mg of vortioxetine and cutting it into even small bits so I could SLOWLY dip my toes into SSRI's again. I was very worried about it. The only think I had the first week was nausea and gas and I worked my way up to 20mg a day. I feel AMAZING! The OCD I had was horrible and landed me in the ER. I had lost 15-20lbs and was in bad shape. The weight gain I have now was much needed and I'm at a steady weight that works for my height. I'm SO grateful I did this. I was also doing Exposure Therapy before and during adding in vortioxetine - I find that is a great way to talk out and better understand the OCD. I hope someone reads this and gets results like me - I know what a dark place OCD can put you. Hang in there. This one is a winner!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):This med was awful. I have tried so many anti-depressants and this was the worst. I have a sensitive stomach already but this med made me so nauseous. I missed several days of work from home because I couldn’t sit up without puking. Forget enjoying even a social drink on these meds, one beer made me puke over 30 times. I thought I had food poisoning. The nausea lasts all day but is particularly bad in the morning. After a month of being on this med, even looking at the pill makes me nauseous and has made tapering down the dose impossible so I am left with withdrawals. Unfortunately, I will never know if this med worked for my depression because it made me so sick. Suggest having your doctors fill an RX anti-nausea if you want to attempt this drug.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):My doctor started me on 5mg for two weeks to be followed by 10mg for two weeks.  The first two weeks were great.  Only mild diarrhea, mild headaches and mild to moderate dizziness.  I just went up to 10mg this morning and it has not been good for me.  I am suicidal, don't want to do anything at all, major anxiety and restlessness.  I am going back down to 5mg.  Besides this it has been so good for my depression.  I want to get up in the morning and it has also helped with intrusive thoughts.  They are not gone entirely but are a lot better to manage.  All in all, I'm having a good experience with Trintellix.  I have free samples and am not sure what the cost to me is yet.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Taken 10mg daily for just over a year, noticed moderate positive effect, but nothing substantial. Most common side effects have been slight weight gain & nausea shortly after taking.

I'm writing this review on my father's behalf with permission, adding my own comments as a family member. He was prescribed this drug at 10mg for depression, replacing a combination of escitalopram (10mg) and bupropion (150mg). The reason being that "it'd provide a faster effect" than the said previous combination. It did perk up his mood quite quickly, but it unfortunately turned out to make him easily agitated and angry. He'd snap over the smallest things, cursing and yelling, and then came the regret. Not a good cycle to be stuck in. It was awkward for us both, because dad's normally a nice and reasonable man. His psychiatrist discontinued the drug after many of the conflicts I described, going back to escitalopram and bupropion. And what a great decision that was! I was happy to have my dad back.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Treating generalized anxiety with therapy and escitalopram 10mg. It worked wonders (I went from over worrying to function perfectly normally) but the sexual side effects were stressing me. I started to feel well and therefore I wanted to get to know people, but sex was weird and orgasm difficult to reach (I’m a 32 year old male). Switched to brintellix 10mg, in 3 days I went from 1h to orgasm to 10 minutes. What I can say is that after some initial unease adjusting to the tapering up of brintellix (no nausea, just generally feeling unwell/sick/fatigued and headaches) after 1 week I have no more side effects. I don’t feel as up in mood as with escitalopram but for now it’s ok. Maybe it will improve. It feels very gentle and not so intense in effect as escitalopram.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Unfortunately Trintellix gave me sexual side effects so I took myself off it. I was hopeful because I was told it did not have the same sexual side effects as the SSRIs. Unfortunately for me it did.
Trintellix (vortioxetine):Worst ever please don’t bother. Major sickness and projectile vomiting, headaches and nightmares. This has made me terrified literally . Awful drug

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Hi there, I started Trintellix 4 days ago at 5mg. Only have slight nausea in mornings when I take it. I am weaning off Effexor which I’ve been on for a couple of years but it’s no longer effective. I’m praying this new med will work as I’ve tried numerous antidepressants in the past two years along with ECT and TMS with little to no improvement. Feeling discouraged. But I know I have to give this a go

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Have been taking 10 mg trintellix for about 6 months now. The honeymoon phase was great, felt happy and energized, outgoing and generally good. It has levelled off to a point where I feel nauseous when I take it and it doesn’t provide the same effects at all, if anything it makes the preexisting conditions worse. Considering weening off of if.

A few days in and so far so good.  A little nausea but no bad side effects like other antidepressants.  Would like to view some other reviews for anxiety or panic disorder for Trintellix. Depression seems to be the only condition reviewed on here.

Took 20mg of Vortioxetine for 6+ months. I have awful anxiety that fuels depression. I had tried multiple other anti-depressants with limited success (escitalopram and cymbalta).I decided to switch to Vortioxetine due to it's apparent lack of side-effects - and too my delight, it held up on that end. Many people report severe nausea, however I was lucky enough to only have it mildly, and even then it passed quickly. It also improved my concentration and short term memory slightly, which I loved.Unfortunately, it did very little for my debilitating anxiety. For this reason I can't give it an amazing score. However, I could see this being a wonder drug for those who have depression as a primary symptom rather than anxiety.
Doesn't cure my PTSD obviously but makes life more survivable.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I have never bothered to write a review. i've been on 10mg of trintellix for about 4 months and I have never had any side effects and I feel much better! I have tried so many anti-depressents in the past and couldn't tolerate the side effects. I feel the same as normal but just happier. I am going through some really awful things in my life and will try increasing to 20mg to see if it helps even more. But, for those like me who are sensitive to drugs, this one works for me. I'm a petite woman in late 40s. I get headaches, feel nervous or weird and sick to my stomach on most drugs. This has caused NO problems and I don't feel numb either. I took prozac years ago for a year to get rid of panic attacks and it helped with that, but I felt numb.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Have tried many things for my depression- from (worst)  to best the order is paroxetine/Paxil, Wellbutrin, Prozac, Lexapro, to Serzone/nefazodone (best) - and Trintillex seems to be the best fit for me. I'm  46 years old with co-occurring ADHD/inattentive.  Decreased methylphenidate from 30mg to 15mg after starting trintillex 5mg at night.  Mild nausea day 1-3, but no other adverse effects at week 6.  It takes a little longer to reach orgasm, but it doesn't completely get rid of my libido like other SSRIs.  I started to feel better at week 2, and continue to feel decreased depression & anxiety overall. I have minimal what’s-the-point thoughts, less social anxiety, less irritability, greater emotional regulation.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):This medication saved my life after I experienced recurring panic attacks on Zoloft/Wellbutrin combo. I am now panic-free, energetic, more clear-minded, and content. Thank you Trintellix!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I’ve been on Trintellix for 6 years. I’ve been on SO many medications the years that have after a few years they don’t work anymore . This drug has been life changing for me. With other meds,  I endured quite a few side effects, not so much with Trintellix. The only side effect I’ve had is constipation. It’s manageable. This drug has worked  very well for me.

I've tried about 8 different anti depressive medications for the last 6 years, and once I tried one that was really helping me (aurorix), I had to quit because I was about to start using ADHD medication.After 6 months or so on ADHD medication my depression got bad, my doctor put me on Brintellix. I've used it for about 9 months now, and I can't stand it anymore. The nausea never stops, the headache comes and goes, the feeling of being high in the evening, and the huge sleep problems, not worth it. And even if the medication has improved my depression, it has also made my mood totally flat. I cannot feel anything, I'm flat. I do not even feel anything for my boyfriend, which is a bit scary and makes me wonder if I really do care about him or not. Tomorrow I stop using this medication, I'll rather deal with the depression instead of this careless zombie existence.

Tried to cross-taper from escitalopram to vortioxetine while also taking mirtazapine for sleep. Horrible experience. Felt so out of it, somehow lost contact to my speech! Like I would think I needed to speak but no words came out and had to extremely focus and try to get some words out (to ring my boyfriend because I was vomiting at the train station from it). Awful! Hope it's out of my system soon. Had great mood for two days though until this awful out of it disconnected from myself and world feeling started and felt like my depression was coming back as well, although that could have been cause of lowering the escilatopram.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Unlike other anti depressants I have taken, Trintellix gave me immediate relief. Within a few hours of taking it I could feel a weight being removed from my shoulders, I can't explain it.. I'm just thankful.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I have been taking Trintellix for at least at least a year.  I started out at 5 mg and my doctor increased my dose to 10 mg. I have a long history of antidepressant use.  For 25 years, Prozac was a lifesaver and I was able to work and function in society. Then Prozac stopped working for me and I experienced a slow decent into a terrible depression along with crippling anxiety and insomnia. My doctor put me on Paxil which made me feel like a Zombie.  I also tried several other antidepressants that did not work. Then I was prescribed Trintellix which helped bring me out of depression and increased my quality of life. My anxiety symptoms have also been reduced, however, I still have insomnia. I have had problems with nausea when I take the 10mg dose of Trintellix so my dosage was reduced to 5 mg. I have been on that dose for almost 2 weeks and my nausea symptoms have improved. The only other issue is the cost. I was paying 100 dollars a month out of pocket after insurance paid the rest.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):So far, Trintellix has been working very well for me! I've tried other antidepressants which just made me feel like a zombie, made my depression worse or made me have more frequent anxiety attacks. Finally I decided to give this a chance, and I'm so glad I did! I've been on it for just 10 days at 5mg, but haven't had any bad side effects (minus first 3 days slight nausea), I had a few tough days where I felt pretty down/emotional, but now I'm feeling so much better! I told myself I just gotta push through! Now my anxiety is gone completely, I feel more calm, relaxed and just overall happier! Im hopeful that increasing to 10mg will just keep getting better and better. 10/10, would recommend!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):This med has worked for me after Prozac and Wellbutrin failed.  I like this med because it doesn’t make me feel like a Zombie (I still have emotions).  I also noticed a significant improvement with my anxiety, ability to focus and memory.  I was slightly nauseous the first day I started the med but otherwise, no difficulties.  I hope this works for you too!

I have been on Mirtazapine (45 mg per day) for depression, anxiety and insomnia (symptoms of my borderline personality disorder) for more than half a year; and my psychiatrist prescribed me this drug as an extra to decrease my re-occurring depressive bouts. I started with the lowest dose (5 mg), but still it cancelled out the sleep-enhancing effect of Mirtazapine from day one. I could not sleep more than 5 hours a night, which made me exhausted and irritable during the day. Therefore, I would definitely not recommend it for those patients who are sensitive to stimulants or who need to take sleep-enhancing medications like Mirtazapine, because it might ruin their sleep, indirectly causing nervous exhaustion, which eventually increases depression, thereby doing the exact opposite to what it is designed to do.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Terrible medication. When I first started it it made me severely depressed. It makes me irritable and angry. I'm taking it for severe anxiety but it makes my anxiety worse. Was previously on Lexapro and it was so much better and made me so much happier.

This medication turned out to be an awful drug for me and my anxiety, it sent me loopy and I am  still recovering from it 5 months later.  I have had  so many side effects that I have lost count. It is an absolute head mangler.  I hope no one else has the same experience. All the best.Ps wouldn't even give it one out of 10 more like minus 10

Switched from escitalopram 20mg to vortioxetine 20mg because of sexual side effects. It was the best decision of my life. I felt constantly sleepy, down, and emotionally blunted with zero libido on Lexapro, Zoloft and other SSRIs. Vortioxetine took longer to have an effect, but once it kicked in at the 3 week mark, I finally felt better. Emotions were normalized and I started feeling much more confident about myself and around other people. It helped my social anxiety in that regard and also made me super motivated and willing to go outside. Interacting with people finally felt easy and natural. I think some of these effects can also be attributed to the previous addition of 300mg bupropion which also raises plasma levels of Brintellix and makes it more effective.

I’d been wanting to try vortioxetine for a long time and after a bout with venlafaxine that led me to A&E very ill my CMHT agreed to let me try it. I’ve been on it for about 6 weeks at 10mg and I feel alive again. For awhile I’d been in some sort of post psych ward fog where I had accepted I was alive but begrudgingly. Now since starting this drug I am happy to be alive - and even better no side effects not even sexual (something that’s affected me with every anti depressants but mirtazapine). If you find the effects of other anti depressants lacklustre or give you sexual side effects I would really push your psych to let you try it, it costs the NHS (here in the UK) a lot but it’s inexpensive compared to the management of poorly medicated depression/poor adherence due to sexual side effects. Etc - since starting it I’ve been able to drop my CPN appointments from weekly to fortnightly hopefully to non soon

Hi.. I'm 24.. had mental health issues for 10 years. In the beginning I was diagnosed at 16 years old with depression and anxiety disorder.  I've taken over 13 medications in that time - I know thats a lot lol. I've struggled with self harm/low mood/severe mood swings/panic attacks and suicide attempts since 14. I genuinely feel vortioxetine saved my life. Yes I still struggle with mood swings/anxiety etc/as I have BPD now

Worked very well for me. I was crippled by depression with intense suicidal ideation. Now my moods are very stable and I feel comfortable enough to start tapering off soon. I had to up dose to 15mg and it took about 8 weeks to finally work, plus an additional 2 months to get full effect.Minimal side effects: slightly aching testicles that resolved in 2 weeks. Slight nausea that also resolved. Harder to ejaculate, which has also improved over time.I'm lucky this medicine worked for me.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I had been on ESCITALOPRAM  and suffered from sexually side effects.  I looked at that as more of an issue than helping me when there were so many others I could try! I was given trintellix ( my DR told me this is a newer drug known to have low reviews of people suffering with sexual side effects) I tried to take it in the morning, this made ME so nauseous. I then tried taking it at lunch time after I had eaten my lunch thinking taking it with food would help for sure. Unfortunately it didn’t and taking it at night didn’t either. I woke up nauseous every morning. I let this be my normal for as long as I could (six 1/2 months) but I felt awful. I had no appetite. I lost nearly 30lbs which yeah sounds awesome right?It’s not!! This was such an unhealthy way to do so and I felt awful. Mentally wise I could notice a difference but I could not shake the side effects.If you are trying to stick it out in hopes the side effects get better they should be better within 10 weeks max.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I was given this drug a few years ago. I took it for approximately a year after a near suicide attempt. It got me out of that place and helped me get back on solid ground.I stopped taking it for a few years and when I found myself in a dark place again I went back on it.Unfortunately this time I found racing thoughts of suicide occupied most of my days and I was shortly thereafter diagnosed with rapid cycling mixed state BPII.This medication worked great and then it didn’t.Disclaimer though, apparently my bipolar progressed as I aged and the bipolar depression is more likely why it didn’t work anymore.I did have a great year or so on it before my chemistry changed.
Trintellix (vortioxetine):If you do not want to gain a significant amount of weight, stay away from this medication!!!!Our daughter gained 60 pounds in 3 months!!!!!Awful

Trintellix (vortioxetine):This medicine makes me super nauseous, more depressed, very agitated, cry  non stop and my head hurts.   I feel like a crazy person.     And this is on just 1/3 of a 5 Ml tablet.    Not taking it anymore.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I was extremely skeptical about SSRI's all of them made me sick , Zoloft, escitalopram , Effexor (hypomania), I am now with Trintellix 10mg since 3 days and I am feeling a little better already without any side effects. I hope I'm good with it for a while so this depression and anxiety stop wasting my precious life time. God be with you all. Depression shouldn't exist. I believe that there is an antidepressant that can fit for everyone. Trintellix was my third try with antidepressant , I was so scared about my depression. Been 1 months and a half suffering from anxiety and depression and it feels already like a life long threats.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I was prescribed Trintellix for my GAD and MDD.  I’ve been taking 5 mgs for a week now.  The first two days I experienced nausea and I am still experiencing headaches and some fatigue, which I suspect will go away In the next week.  So far, I am very pleased with Trintellix. I have already begun to see a reduction of my GAD and MDD symptoms.  Before Trintellix I tried Paxil, Zoloft, Lexapro, Pristiq and Effexor all of which gave me horrible side effects and left me feeling very zombie like.  So far no zombie like feeling with Trintellix.  I will post an updated review when I hit the 4 week mark.  I’m hopeful that my GAD and MDD symptoms will continue to improve.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I wrote a detailed explanation which was apparently too long for this forum so long story short, 1st week was good, 2nd week developed extreme anxiety, high BP, high heart rate, insomnia, and horrible akathisia. Had high hopes, but ended up being a nightmare. Akathisia was a nightmare. Will probably work for most, but beware that it may cause akathisia.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):At first I did not feel any relief from gloom.  After 4 weeks I see improvement.  The veil of gloom is gone. It is subtle, not fireworks. But am optimistic as I am interested in doing things, more patient and don't feel down.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I was on Viibryd and doing well, but my insurance stopped covering it at the start of the year. My doctor recommended trintellix since it was the most similar. One dose at bedtime last night, and I will never take it again. My stomach started feeling queasy about 30 minutes after taking the pill, which progressed to stomach pain, explosive diarrhea, and awful gas as the night wore on. When I finally quit running to the bathroom, the stomach pain made it difficult to fall asleep. When I finally fell asleep about 90 minutes later, I experienced nightmares and hallucination-like episodes where even when I startled awake I was convinced I could still see the nightmares happening. Happened a couple of times and made for a terrible night’s sleep. When I got up the next morning, I started vomiting. I will never take another pill of this. Already have a call in with my doctor to get something different.

In my case, this drug only done harm to me. From the get go I got severe side effects, from nausea, to sweating, to mental confusion. I’ve had to ring an emergency line today because I had symptoms so bad, as soon as I take this drug it completely changes my mood to worse, it took me to a very dark place, my mouth started to water, I felt dizzy, extremely nauseous, my heartbeat was out of control and I could not stand still. I was severely worried for my health, and I feel a lot better when I don’t take it at all. Refuse to take it anymore and getting taken off it as soon as possible. Terrible drug in my opinion. No drug should give side effects this severe. Very frustrating that a drug that is meant to help me makes me feel like this. BTW I'm on it for BPD and depressive disorder.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I tried Trintellix because SSRIs didn't help and I had too many side effects from Wellbutrin. Trintellix helped a little; I felt a little better than I did on Zoloft, but for the most part it turned me into a couch potato. I could spend entire days laying on the couch, half paying attention to the TV. I had no motivation and I was still depressed, so I quit after a few months. I tapered slowly but the withdrawals SUCKED worse than any other med I've quit before. I had the shakes, vomiting, and uncontrollable urges to move around, so I pretty much writhed around in bed and vomited into a bag for days. Not worth it for me.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Trintellix works wonderfully for my anxiety. The only side effect I have is bruxism at night (which I have on every anxiety medicine.) I feel leveled out and can finally relax without my mind going all of the time.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Been on it for over a year. 10 mg daily. Best antidepressant for me ever! Tried them all  & all with HORRIBLE constipation & other side effects. This is the only one that took care of my depression & didn't have any awful side effects other than a little nausea in the beginning. No weight gain, no decreased libido. It's definitely worth a try!

Vortioxetine was the first antidepressant that helped with my chronic/persistent depression and my generalized anxiety disorder. I had tried desvenlafaxine (awful), mirtazapine (OK, but didn't help), and sertraline (horrible). Lyrica had been helping with anxiety, but vortioxetine helped with everything (and, after adding bupropion, I was able to stop takin Lyrica). It even helped a little with my cognition and memory.That being said, it's not like everything went back to normal. It was a very clear improvement, though.

Ive tried so many different anti depressants for my Emotionally unstable personality disorder but this is the first one that has actually lifted me with barely any side effects. I'm getting slight sexual dysfunction but nothing I can't deal with, I'm also struggling to think clearly a little but hoping this goes away as I'm new to taking this drug. I've been able to focus more and have been able to lose 11lbs on a healthy eating program which I would have never dreamt of doing without the help of this medication, I just hope it stays like this.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Has been best for brain fog and organic depression from chronic lymes and primary billiary cholangitis  - I'm an RN and couldn't work without it!!!!  It is worth every penny for me started to lift brain fog from day one!
Trintellix (vortioxetine):Great medicine. I've been though many different kinds and trintellix is great.

Psychiatrist has put me on Brintellix (vortioxetine -Trintellix) for what he considered was GAD/Moderate Depression, although my GP and myself never agreed on the "depression" part. Had terrible anxiety  in the three weeks I was on it. Could be that me and my GP were right in that my issue was mainly GAD. Could be that I couldn't be on it longer. I don't know. What I do know is that I had to go to the hospital for my anxiety/panic symptoms which were out of control. I was then put on Zoloft and Diazepam. Zoloft started working on week 7, so I could successfully quit the benzo (after a quick taper). Not a great experience.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Four weeks on Trintellix and I feel it is working better than any other antidepressant mostly due to the fact the side effects are almost non existent. I am not noticing my eating habits going through the roof and I don't have that apathy that I've had with almost all other drugs.  It was tough for a couple of weeks until my digestive systems got use to Trintellix but now it is working great. I am just starting to enjoy some of the things I use to love. I am no longer mourning the two deaths in our family a year ago. I have nothing but good reviews for Trintellix. I am on 10g.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I was suffering from OCD and anxiety. My doctor put me on Trintellix 10 mg/day. I took it for about a month but my anxiety got worse after a few days. I contacted my doctor and let him know that this medication has made me more anxious but he said that is not Trintellix causing these symptoms and your anxiety is too high. He increased the dose to 20 mg/day. After a few days, the pins-and-needles sensation became a permanent issue & had significant apprehension, got insomnia, stomach pain, itchy skin. My psychiatrist was still insisting that I should give this medication at least for one more month. So, I decided to change my psychiatrist. The new doctor asked me to gradually reduce the Trintellix dose and get rid of it within two weeks. He prescribed me Clonazepam 0.5 mg twice a day. After a few days, I am feeling much better. Everything has improved and I am getting my life back. I know that Clonazepam might not be a reasonable long-term solution but Trintellix was a real nightmare.

I was prescribed Brintellix after heading back down the depression/anxiety rabbit hole. Been on Lexapro twice before but made me a little zombie so wanted to try a less numbing medication. It’s been a year and the depression is well and truly under control, however I don’t feel like it ever helped with the anxiety and in the last month I have been spiraling. Heading back to the GP to try something better suited to GAD.

Recently did a review on this drug one word of warning just read up on the withdrawal symptoms you will have on this drug before taking it they are horrendous lundbeck says you can stop it suddenly with no side effects what a load of rubbish it has the worst withdrawal I have ever had on any medication

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Why is the Trintellix commercial featuring ALL females?? Do men not get depression? This drug made me throw up if I didn’t take it and go right to bed. I was nauseous all day and I took it for months. Mood was ok

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I've been on  most of SSRIs, SNRIs & Buproprion.My depression started to worsen & my Dr suggested trying Trintellix with a caution that  1/5 people suffered from nausea severe enough to stop taking it. I started on 5mg in the morning and I'm not sure if it was the Trintellix but my mood and depression worsened to the point of suicidal ideation. Fortunately, I was in a hospital environment. I suffered nausea but it was manageable. Around day 6, I started to feel a little better. By day 8 I actually felt happy for the first time in a long time. Additionally, my thinking became much clearer. Cloudy thinking had been a problem with other SSRIs. I'm now on day 10 and increased to 10mg with no adverse reactions. One lesson I've learned is that SSRIs do different things to different people. Given Psychiatrists don't know exactly how these drugs work/differ from each other, it's a case of trying one, giving it 6-8 weeks to work and if it's not working go back to your Doctor.

Prescribed for anxiety worked well for first few weeks the had a weird episode when I woke up and couldn't sit still. Seemed to go down hill from there found it a horrible medicine couldn't sleep, eat, had a lot of stomach bloat and wind was told it didn't cause sexual dysfunction, which it did.  I'm going back in venlaflaxine hopefully will get betterHope it works for you

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Initially this medicine Trintellix was sorta working for me or my doctor was convincing me it was, but then my anxiety returned and every morning I found myself incredibly nauseous and puking which made me feel awful for the rest of the day. I typically took 20mg after dinner to ease the nausea but always ended up sick when I woke up in the morning. It’s also expensive. Not worth it in my opinion.

My doctor prescribed me to start with gradual increase of 10mg of Brintellix (vortioxetine) so in 3 days I was on full tablet. On the third day I had a panic attack due to uncomfortable side effects - increased heartbeat, chest burn, severe nausea and headache. Had to take beta blocker to calm down. Followed doc's advice to restart with smaller dose and longer period to reach full tablet in 10 days. Week 1 and 2: sense of reduced generalized anxiety. I felt slight improvement. However... Mood swings. Constant condition of feeling hot and minor nausea during the day. Exhausting.   Week 3 and 4: increased anxiety and shortness of breath. Worst symptoms: two episodes of unexplained extreme aggression while talking on a phone - I quickly lost my temper and was yelling and swearing for almost no reason. Smashed my phone against the wall and floor three times. Was difficult to stop - took time to wind down.My doctor recommended to stop and switch to another drug.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):It took me a month to notice the effects, it works wonders, I have more energy and motivation, I take it in combination with Lamictal. It has no sexual side effects or fatigue. It's good for me but your mileage may vary.

Prescribed vortioxetine for depression, anxiety and trichotillomania. While the first few months on 10mg saw me hair pulling in a week what I would in a day pre-treatment, after a year the medication has well and truly stopped working and now I am back to square one.Depression was treated and anxiety minimally improved.Recently having E.D. issues, may or may not be related. I have come off the meds abruptly but with no side effects to my knowledge.One side effect of this medication was strange dreams, be prepared for that.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):It’s an okay medication for anxiety. Does cause some digestive issues. I’ve been on Citaloptam, Zoloft, Wellbutrin, Mirtazapine, etc. This one seems to be the best tolerated for me. Zoloft and Citalopram took away my sex drive. Wellbutrin made me anxious, suicidal, and an insomniac. Mirtazapine is a great medication. Prob the best one, but the weight gain isn’t for me. I like to have an active sex life and getting fat isn’t on my list. My doctor recommended Trintellix. It does limit my sex drive a little (thankfully I have a high sex drive), but I am still horny and happy. I do struggle to sleep though, so I’m also on Trazadone. If you are skinny, go for mirtazapine, it by far the best for anxiety.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I was so far down I was ready to give up. I begged my Dr for help, I cried all day everyday, I couldn't get out of bed, i thought i was going to die . I prayed,  i begged for someone to please help me. My husband an kids didnt know what to do. I was I in a black hole but He kept me on the same old antidepressants.  I decided to changed doctors , I dont beleive for one minute that my old doctor cared if I died . So i went online and found a different doctor and my new Dr put me on Trentellix. Along with Katmin  treatment. I finally was able to get out of bed, to be able to go to work, cook a meal, not cry everyday.  It was like I woke up . I truly beleive if I hadn't changed doctors and found Trentellix I would not be here today. It's the best medication in the world for ME!  This medication saved my life.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I took this medication for more than a month and during that time, I felt my depression worsen significantly. My psychiatrist took me off the medication and my depression subsided some.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I struggle with severe anxiety, worrying and OCD. I’ve been on Trintellix for 2 months. I started taking it because I was obsessing and catastrophizing over a toxic person.  My thoughts would repeat in my mind and I felt suicidal.  It was a legal situation that I thought would ruin me.  Wellbutrin 300 XL did absolutely nothing; in fact it may have made me worse. So I started on 5 mg of Trintellix and in days I felt my thoughts more glued and my fear and anxiety subsided enough to stop my suicide ideation.  When this situation ends I may not need it but for now it’s helping me out a lot.  I’m on 10 mg now and I think I’ll stay on 10 mg.  One last benefit is my cognition/concentration is sharper; a bonus for work.  Hope it works for you!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I have had depression for over 30 years, was successfully stable, and even happy, for over 20 years with antidepressants. My mood began to slip downward slowly over a couple of years. Finally asked my doctor about it. After trying a few different antidepressants and with little effect, I was given Trintellix, told that it was a GREAT drug, but it would take up to seven weeks to achieve full effect. After only a few days, my depression worsened dramatically. Then I started shaking, my heart was racing, I began crying more, and I was convinced I was going to die. Doc thought this was progression of my symptoms, but it wasn't. I was cognitively impaired by then. I am convinced that Trintellix did something horrible to my brain chemistry/regulation. It has been 15 months since the Trintellix nightmare. I never fully recovered. Still living in the nightmare of whatever happened to my brain. So many treatments since then, antidep. of different classes, mood stabilizers, ElectroCV.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Started on 5 MG daily for two weeks after taking wellbutrin 300 xl and duloxetine 20 daily which caused severe tinnitus and jaw pain and bruxism fracturing  three teeth. Initially got some minor nausea but the jaw pain lessened and totally disappeared.  I felt good with some minor anxiety.  After 2 weeks increased to 10 mg daily.  Again, then nausea returned but was gone on day four.  I do have some jaw tension now but not too bad.  I feel more alive.  Doing tasks are easier.  My spouse says I look more relaxed.  On a scale of 1:10 I give myself a 6.  Laughter comes naturally now.  Sad movies give me a lump in the throat and tears.   Thank God for Trintellix as it is returning my life to me.

Its my 3rd week on vortioxetine in the first 2 week I took 5mg Now my dose is 10mg daily.My appetite is better, my mood has improved a lot, I didn't experienced any side effects. (I'm an older teenager)

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Trintellix has been the worst medicine in my life. I have tried this last year and made my depression worst, I went through living nightmare. Again this time my dr prescribed me Trintellix I took it for 4 weeks felt lots of side effects I called my dr she made me stop ✋ now it had been 4 weeks I am going crazy I have the worst days of my life. My dr has been very careless have been trying to reach her she won’t answer. My advice is not to take Trintiliex they have the worst withdrawal side effects.

Love this. Been on many meds for many years and each were either ineffective or came with unwanted side effects - mainly loss of libido. Clomipramine worked like a dream for panic but completely blocked any interest in sex.Started on low dose, 5mg with no side effects and libido gradually returned. Now on 10mg and maintain interest in sex and panic is very well controlled.Everyone is different but for me this is by far the best med I have used for panic disorder

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I have been on trintellex (have worked my way from 5mg dose to 20mg) for 8 months now. Has helped with anxiety a lot. It got me out of a sad place initially but depressive symptoms came back after 4-5 months of taking it. I gained about 25 pounds and have stomach bloat. Sex drive is gone. I don't recommend trintellex for long term use. The weight gain and loss of sex drive only make the depressive symptoms worse

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I took Trintellix 10mg per day. In the past I tried several other antidepressants with little success. Unfortunately I did not have a good experience with this medication either. During the first month I felt excessively angry and irritable all day. I knew that wasn't like me but I kept taking the medicine because I know the first month can be rough, and I wanted to see the benefits. The medicine also made me feel sick to my stomach sometimes like a sudden wave of nausea. Things went easier after the first month and a half and I stayed on the same strength for another two months. At the three month marker I felt only slightly better in general and noticed the same occasional sharp dips in mood as when I wasn't taking any medicine. The benefits weren't as great as I thought they would be and I had more or less constant stomach/bowel issues, so it wasn't worth it for me. I'm no longer on this medication and have chosen not to replace it with another.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Have been taking Trintellix for 18 days for anxiety accompanied with depression Side effects started in first week. Everything from lowering sexual performance to constant itching with slight headache among others including insomnia. Feel worse than before taking it. Cannot recommend for anyone. Seems to bring on anxiety. Anyone suffering for so long with anxiety and depression certainly doesn't need this added pain. We suffer so much we'll basically try any new med for relief. DON'T TRY THIS ONE!!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I have Anxiety/OCD/Depression. I took this pill for a year and it was the most amazing medication I had ever been on for my anxiety. I started low and took it at night to try and sleep away most side effects. But I did have diarrhea for the first 3 days of upping my dose and I only went up to 10mg. But then it would go away and I noticed a difference in my anxiety at 7.5mg but I seriously was able to live my life and I never knew what genuine happiness was until this medicine. BUT after taking it for 6 months I started to gain weight so fast.. I gained 40 pounds the following 6 months and then stopped taking it because it made me starving, I never felt full and these kinds of meds are known to effect your metabolism in a bad way. So yes this pill is amazing but I got fat on it.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):So perhaps I am a lucky one but I have not experienced nausea from this drug. I am on 20mg Trintellix and I do find it to be more activating if not taken with food but I like it - I am on it for bipolar 2 disorder. I have been taking it for around 7 months now. I am taking it along with 50mg Pristiq and 150mg lamictal. This is a supplemental medication for me meant to help more with the cognitive aspects of my illness and I feel as though it is working to that end. The only downside is that it is expensive as anything.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I went into a mild depression but major anxiety situation. I started Trintellix 6 days ago. Today I feel the best. I found myself happy and chatting with everyone I saw. I had slight nausea the first 4 days. I took it in the morning with a banana and it was fine. Kept a little something in my stomach the first 3 days. I did have trouble sleeping but took half a Benadryl and it helped. I’m feeling good today. I’m hopeful it will work for me. My doctor said I can come off of it in 90 days. It’s just to build up my seratonin levels. He only suggested 5mg. Try to stay with it if you have no major side effects

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I took Trintellix and I had awful side effects.  Life began to seem not worthy.  I also developed Tardive Dyskinesia.  And still have it after a year and a half.  It drives me crazy.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I started trintellix 3 years ago. I stopped it twice. I got back on them because I didn't have any other choice. My family doctor just retired and I cannot live without medication and it kind of help with anxiety but not so much with depression. I'm ALWAYS confused, no sex drive, constant nausea, some food that I loved now taste disgusting. I have abnormal intolerance to almost everything that has a strong smell. I cannot use mint toothpaste because of the odor and taste... I cannot concentrate. It's just an awful medication for me. I can wait to have an appointment with my new doctor to finally say good bye to this. I took cipralex and zoloft in the past and it was better.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):This medication has been a lifesaver. I have tried so many different antidepressants (Prozac, Zoloft, Wellbutrin, Lexapro, etc.) and none of them have worked as well as Trintellix. My episodes have disappeared and I finally feel stable which has allowed me to make important life decisions that I was always too fearful to do. In the past, I felt that I couldn’t trust my emotions because they felt too extreme. After years of constant sadness, worrying, and lack of motivation, I am relieved to feel like my normal self.I had maybe 3-4 days where I felt nauseous but overall, I do not experience this side effect. I have been on 10mg for approximately one month and it’s been the most joyous month I’ve had in years. I highly recommend this medication.

My doctor prescribed 10mg daily for anxiety, I was initially quite nervous to take this after reading the reviews on this website as well as hearing about the nausea side effects. I have been taking 10mg daily for just over a 3 weeks now and I have started to notice the difference between how I was prior to taking them. I feel more relaxed in day to day life as well as not having a constant anxious feeling about various events throughout the week. I initially felt nausea for the first few days but it has subsided. I would recommend 100%, so far.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I've had BP II since middle/high school and am 30 now. I've only been on Trintellix for two days at a dose of 5 mg (plan to go to 10mg in 4 more days, if I want to). No side effects so far, which is a big plus among SNRIs like this & fingers crossed it doesn't continue. Latuda has been a godsend, so I remain on that while taking this. The research is very promising as with these reviews for MDD/depression. It's meant to work within 7-10 days per medical research (not anecdotes), and the anecdotal reports support this. Hoping this helps with my depressive period of BP and the accompanying fatigue and low motivation! Note: my insurance is very good that this drug is free, but other insurance typically makes this $0-10 with the patient assistance card.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):The day I took trintellix I feel my throat open up. I felt the effects of it almost immediately. It has changed my life. I have taken other antidepressants and they’re only made me feel so terrible with vomiting and feeling so down. I was hesitant to try anything else yet my amazing doctor who I trust very dearly told me how effective trintellix has been for anxiety although it is commonly used for depression. Changed my life. Highly recommend. Ps. My doctor reassured me that trintellix would be the right drug for me if I had no side effects. That’s why I trusted to try it. If you’re having side effects it’s not the right drug for you and you should commit to trying other meds till you find the right fit. The right fit may take several tries yet I promise and can reassure you, it will change your life for the better. Trust in the process and commit to finding the right fit with the help and surveillance of your doctor. You won’t regret it.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Started Trintellix in a VERY LOW DOSE.. seemed to help. After 3 months, didn’t seem to help at all. Increased my dose, then the vomiting, weight gain went crazy!! Had to leave work several times because of vomiting!! I am a nurse in a VERY busy emergency department!! Grateful they didn’t fire me!Then the weight gain - up 20 LBS!! They claimed  no significant effect on weight.. LYING!!! Never again.. weaned off.. I’ll deal with being sad!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I started Trintellix 2 months ago for anxiety/depression. I've been on Wellbutrin which helps my mood & can counteract some sexual side effects so I’ve stayed on it but it hasn’t really helped my anxiety. I’ve been on Zoloft, lexapro (horrible experience) and cymbalta, all had side effects I ultimately found unlivable. Honestly, starting trintellix was rough but if you can manage, stick with it! I had pretty bad nauseousness but only threw up once within the first few days of starting, & I started super slow & low. No other side effects and this is the first med that has not affected my sexual function.  My anxiety is lessened and I feel hopeful. The daily nausea has gone away although I’ve noticed I’m more prone to motion/car sickness but my doctor gave me zofran for that.  So far this Wellbutrin/trintellix combo is the best I’ve found for me.P.S. go through their website to get your Rx card to help with costs it helped my price tremendously

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I just started two days on this drug. I was told take it with food in the morning to stop nausea. First day my stomach was upset but no vomiting. Today I took it after I ate and within a hour or so I vomited so badly my throat is completely sore. Is this normal? This is such an expensive drug, even with insurance I paid almost $200. I don’t want to discontinue the use just yet but I am not sure I can handle the nausea and vomiting. Anyone else having these same issues?

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I'm in my early 30's- been dealing with depression for almost 15 years. My former doc prescribed me trintillex. he swore it was a super "clean" med with out side effects. it's been 2+ years taking it (max 20mg) & I had no positive effects. Don't let your doc tell you it won't/rarely causes weight gain. IT DOES, especially if you're a female. It will continue the longer on it/dose increased. Also, awful GI problems- bad nausea or bad constipation. Also only makes anxiety worse especially if you take in the AM- take in PM you can't sleep ^_^  I would stay away from this drug DEFINITELY if you have anxiety, sensitive stomach, prone to weight gain from meds. I'm done off this in 4 days! can't wait

I’m taking this for anxiety and obsessive thoughts which started after a large bender the previous year after lads trip to Ibiza. The first 4-8 weeks were pretty bad and it didn’t seem to work, in fact my anxiety and thoughts felt much worse.  I found it hard to sleep but didn’t have any other side affects. After 8-10 weeks and increasing the dose to 15mg things started to work. Sleep massively improved and coupled with meditation my anxiety is practically non existent. It can flare up though after a drinking lots of beers. The obsessive/taboo thoughts are still there but more manageable. Overall my experience has been good. Very little to no side affects which others have reported. I lead a normal life - just got to sometimes remind myself I’m 35 not 25 (3 glasses of wine a week and not 3 bottles is now the rule). Hope this helps - just be patient with it as it took almost 10 weeks for it to work for me.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I have always suffered from anxiety and depression. Having to go to work as a nurse's not knowing what the next day would bring was making my anxiety out of control.  I went off Wellbutrin, started low dose of Trintellix. The anxiety was quickly gone, but I feel blah, crying al ot, getting depressed easily.  I'm going top try and get back into working out again and see if that helps.

This drug ruined my life, I'm 19 years old and have had severe headaches and restless legs since I was on it. It's been 2 month since I quit it. I have headaches that only seem to get worse.  I know it's rare to have this reaction. But I want to make sure someone out there considering trying this think twice, is it worth ending up like me, where the pain is so high I cant even think, and restless legs that don't stop.

I’ve been on Trintellix for 6 weeks now.  I have been on anti depressants for 15 years and I’m 62.  I am only on 5 mg and didn’t increase.  I’m sensitive to meds.  I felt good right away and more motivated and alert.  I did have nausea every time I took it.  I would take a 1/2 zofran and that helped.  Now I get nauseous only occasionally . My only complaint is my anxiety is still bad.  I wake up with anxiety at night.  I don’t know if increasing to 10 mg would help or not.  I do know that so many people on this forum don’t seem to give the meds enough time to work and I always feel worse before I feel better.  I’m wondering if this pandemic we are in is increasing my anxiety and I just have to deal with it.  I don’t feel as sad,  unmotivated, and tired all the time, since I’ve been on trintellix.  I will continue using it.  I just wish it wasn’t so expensive!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I went on this medication because I have a condition called PGAD (persistent genital arousal disorder). The condition I have is absolutely horrible. I was previously on zoloft for over 10 years 100mg. It starts to flatten out so my doctor also gave me Wellbutrin 150mg in 2016/2017. In May 2019 my PGAD condition occurred (reasons are still unknown). I was then told to go off zoloft due to it's sexual side effects and try something else. My doctor gave me Trintellix 10mg. At first it worked okay. I felt super nauseous for a while. Then later almost every night I waa throwing up an hour after taking Trintellix. I took Trintellix for 8 months with zero relief of the vomiting. I have to take domperidone before my trintellix so I don't puke. My condition sort of got better now it is terrible. I also have anxiety and panic attacks nearly every day and cry very easily. It just isn't the pill for me. It was used for my anxiety and did not work.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I was on Cipralex for 5 years for anxiety and depression and my anxiety was better but about depression it was up and down, my dr switched me to trintellix 20 about 6 months ago and I feel my depression is getting better. I feel more happy but it worsened my anxiety ! I don't think this drug helps for anxiety at all !!!

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Trintellex started working by the end of the second week and continues to.  I am happier than I have ever been and so impressed that Trintellex was able to get me through the incredibly difficult last two months, e.g changed jobs, had a project with an impossible deadline, the holidays, etc.  I'm on 10mg daily.  Side effect-wise  I have some sexual dysfunction (loss of libido, difficult to achieve orgasm) but right now it seems worth it to feel this good.  I've also lost weight. A new wrinkle as of 2 weeks ago is a tinnitus.  I only notice it when its totally quiet which hasn't made sleeping the best so I take Trazadone to help with that which works great.  After two months, I'm still feeling great on the Trintellex but the side effects aren't dissipating and I'm wondering how long I will be able to deal with them.  Definitely not forever.  Will update if things change.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I started Trintellix at 10mg over 4 weeks ago after being on Prestiq for over a year.  I have been going into a deeper depression then I have ever experienced.  I have sweats, upset stomach (take in morning with food). My nerves are shot and I don't want to leave my bedroom. I used to be so active in life now I just want to hide. I am going to my doctor today to request being taken of this medication and be put on something else.  This medicine has just made my life worse than ever before. If you are deciding on what to go on I would not recommend this product.

Trintellix made me have suicidal thoughts every week. As soon as I went off it, I never had another suicidal thought. It was like night and day. I have been told, stay away from these drugs, they will mess you up. Now I know.

I have been on this medication vortioxetine for 6 months, I feel awful, such side effects that I have decreased my meds from 10mg to 5mg and will be going off it. Anger outbursts, fits of rage. Trouble sleeping, tired all the time, terribly lethargic. I wouldn't recommend it, it has worked for some but I guess it depends on what other meds you are on and what is right for you.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Was switched to Trintellix from Citalopram as it interfered with an antibiotic I needed. I have been on it for 3 weeks now. Absolutely horrible! I have never felt this crazy. I feel like I am loosing my mind. Constant panic attacks, sensitivity to even the slightest sounds, lightheaded/dizziness, nausea, suicidal ideations, difficulty breathing. I am suffering from severe mood swings. I stopped taking it tonight. Just can’t do it anymore. I rather have nothing than this.
Trintellix (vortioxetine):Worked quickly and effectively for me.  I did have some side effects that lasted a week or so each time I upped the dose, but they went away.  On 20mg for most of 16 months

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Was prescribed this after Cipralex taking away my emotions.I've only been on it for two days, only 2.5 mg, but it's awful.My anxiety is the highest it's ever been, I'm always crying and I can't even do anything. Not going to torture myself with this any longer. Discontinuing tomorrow. Not worth it.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):It’s been great. Take 10mg nightly along with 300mg Wellbutrin xl in the morning. Initial stomach problems for about 2 months, but now no problems. Could not tolerate drinking on this medication. No sexual side effects which has been a god send. If your insurance covers it/can afford I recommend.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Very happy, 90% depression symptom reduction. Only drawback is I’ve gained 10lbs and haven’t been able to get it off yet but I’m mentally I’m the best I’ve been in years so worth the trade off tbh.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I have update after 13 weeks.So I started Trintellix for MDD/Anxiety/OCD.First 2-3 weeks really fast improvement with my energy and motivation, but after 5 - 6 weeks I had severe headache and cold chills. Took a break for 2-3 days and started again. Motivation again but still "not myself". Couldn't sleep with 10 mg, its really activating, my blood pressure went high, so must cut back to 5 mg, seems its ok, no nausea, less brain fog, better cognition. Keep update next.

I started taking vortioxetine about 4 years ago. 5mg was enough for me to keep debilitating anxiety at bay. Helped a lot with depression and no sexual side effects or weight gain. After a few years I tried to wean myself off and was taking 5mg every second day for a little while. But I realised I needed to stay on it as my anxiety came back badly so I started taking it again and quickly went up to 15mg. Have now been putting on weight and having lots of sugar/carbcravings like on other antidepressant. I am now going to go back to 10mg and if the weight won’t go I’ll have to go back to 5mg. Hopefully it still works at these lower levels without the weight gain/cravings.

I started this medication for severe depression and anxiety, it was thought to have less side effects and from what I read, I thought that would be the case too. Instead, it had the worst side effects of any antidepressant I’ve ever taken, my anxiety is really severely worse and my depression hasn’t improved at all. In response to this they doubled my dose to 20mg. But the side effects were even worse and they won’t stop the medication. Please don’t tolerate horrible side effects like I’ve been forced too.

Taking this medication for anxiety. I started at 10 mg with no or little effect then went up to 20 mg. Side effects are crazy dreams, insomnia, nausea and increased anxiety. I would not recommend this medication to people with GAD. Horrible.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I swapped from Cipralex to Trintellix because of the major sexual dysfunction Cipralex caused on me.I've been on 5mg 2 weeks now and after 1,5 weeks I really noticed improvement. At beginning I was feeling nausea all the time and had diarrhea but those went away with time. My erection is a lot better than it used to and I feel the sense in my penis is also getting better. With Cipralex it was just numb and I had no libido. After 2 weeks I highly recommend this drug. My anxiety is a lot better but sleeping is still a bit difficult and I need Zopinox to fall asleep, hoping it'll get better too.

I have depression and anxiety and have been on a few different antidepressants (Escitalopram, duloxetine, paroxetine, sertraline) and all of them I had different bothersome side effects. They are all good antidepressants don't get me wrong, but I just had short term memory problems and forgetfulness on all of them so my doc gave me vortioxetine (aka trintellix, brintellix) and I don't have any side effects except nausea when I take it without eating in a period of 1 hour. Other than that I love it and finally don't have any annoying side effects. Hope you find your medication :)

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I was really hopeful for Trintellix because within the first few days the brain fog cleared up, which is what motivated my prescriber to get me started on it and switch from Prozac. I was actually doing well on Prozac, except the brain fog. I'm also postpartum, which is known for the brain fog/lack of memory. I've noticed from the reviews this medication either works really well, or sends you down a depression spiral. You either lose weight and appetite or you gain it. Unfortunately, I've experienced the  latter. I am calling tomorrow to get off it. I am angry, sad, hopeless, really hungry, bloated/gassy, lethargic, snappy, poor concentration, itchy.

I have GAD and depression. I tried a few different antidepressants (Escitalopram, duloxetine, paroxetine, sertraline) and had a few annoying different side effects with each one. But my main bothersome side effect was forgetfulness and short-term memory loss. So my Doc prescribed me Vortioxetine and until now I had no memory problems and no side effects except nausea when I don't eat with the medication. Other than that I love it :)
Trintellix (vortioxetine):Worst drug ever. Do not recommend. Expensive, overpriced, and has barely ANY effect.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):When I first started trintellix I went  the dose increases like I should. Started at 5 mg  dose, then 10 mg. No major issues. I noticed the slightest nausea when brushing my teeth, but that was it. I knew to take it on a full stomach so I wouldn’t feel sick. Then it was time to go up to 20 mg. So I did. After a day or so I had strong nausea. So my doctor and I decided to go back to 10 mg as it worked. Few years later and a different doctor, I was feeling more depressed and tried a different drug which didn’t work. So I went back to trintellix. We decided maybe I didn’t have nausea that bad or maybe it was something else. So I switched, started fine on 5 mg and went up to 10 mg with no issues. Went to 15 mg and the depression felt like it was finally under control with only nausea brushing my teeth. Well we decided to go up to 20 mg. And guess what? Nausea. It was so bad today I just had to lay there and take a nap until I felt better. So I guess 15 mg is my sweet spot for this drug.

Had to change meds I was given vortioxitine 5mg felt good for the first week no major side effects then bam... confusion mind my words were not coordinating with my brain falling to the side the sickness feeling and physically sick I was angry aggressive almost to the point of being violent. Psychiatrist called me I have now stopped this med got a five day wash out until I see him hopefully be back on Citalopram that’s the only bed they settles in my system. Glad to be off this awful med.

I’ve just started Vortioxetine I’m hoping for a good outcome for my depression . It’s only been two days so fingers crossed they work for me. I am itching though and feel slightly sick hopefully this will pass in time. I feel less anxious already so

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Trying a med change after being on Effexor + Lamotrigine for 10 years.  I did the very slow weaning off of Effexor and the  2 weeks on 5mg Trintellix to 10mg.The nausea was bad and consistent, though my body is tolerant of just about everything.  I experienced some burping also, which is very unusual for me.  One day I took 10mg Trintellix with Lamotrigine and only coffee.  I have never vomited so violently and for so long.  I experienced nausea for about a half hour almost every time I took the med with food.  Frequently what followed was a gnawing in my stomach that seemed to cause a strong urge to eat protein foods.  I noticed an increase in blunt/abrasive behavior with family and co-workers.  My doc urged me to back down to 5mg and push through the negative symptoms.  The issues persisted over the next two months and my wife repeatedly asked me to change meds.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):This medication saved my life. I have tried several other drugs which did not help. Wellbutrin was the worst for me, giving me racing and really dark thoughts. Before taking any meds, I had an insane appetite and would wake up starving no matter how much I ate. (In addition to excessive crying, feeling hopeless, not being able to do simple chores like shower). I went a few years suffering like this because I was in denial that I was depressed. Well fast forward a few years later after trying 3 different drugs at different strengths, and Trintellix is the one for me. I never thought I would sleep through the night again. I sleep so soundly now. My appetite is back to normal. My depressive thoughts have been tamed. I am so grateful for this drug and all it has done to improve my quality of life.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Short and sweet— miracle drug for me. I have MDD and anxiety with panic attacks. This medication made me feel like myself again and did not cause any significant side effects. I’m pretty drug naive and I’d never been on a psychiatric drug until now. My life has significantly changed for the best. Please try this drug if you struggle with crippling anxiety that feeds your depression. I started off on a really tiny low dose since I’m super sensitive to medication, and any side effects were tolerable and went away within a week. Give this 2 months to work.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I was RX’d this medication  Trintellix for depression.  I only took it for four days and it was awful, my side effects were I was angry, agitated and my depression worsened. I cried and sobbed uncontrollably.  Discontinued.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I started on  Trintellix 10 mg which was eventually increased to 20 mg.  My experience was nothing but positive. It treated my depression with minimal side effects. The only side effect which I experience is jaw clenching which I am able to control with increased mindfulness.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):Throughout the years, I have tried Effexor XR, Celexa, Lexapro and Cymbalta for my depression. They work for a few years then don't. My doctor just RX'd Trintellix. I had a 14 day supply of the 5mg and and 14 day supply of the 10 mg. I have only been on the 5 mg for four days and it is awful! I'm tired, anxious and have vivid dreams, which I could deal with but the depression (crying all day and  real dark thoughts) has increased and I am extremely angry and agitated. I will be discontinuing immediately.
Trintellix (vortioxetine):may have caused akathisia and caused hives on legs and arms

Trintellix (vortioxetine):On 10 mg I experience noticeable effect after 5 weeks. At the beginning I didn't have worse anxiety, just nausea, headache, vivid dreams. Was activating for the first 3 weeks and my cognitives improved so fast. Effects on anxiety started at week 4.

In continuation to my last post on 14 Nov 2019, I can say that though the reduction to 2.5 mg per day improved my erectile response, after 3 days  I could feel my depression making an ominous return. So yesterday , the 19th  Nov 2019, I have returned back to my original dose of 5 mg orally per day. The depression has slightly dissipated. Now I plan to continue with 5mg daily for the next 6 months, at least.

Trintellix (vortioxetine):I have bipolar disorder and I started having suicidal/homicidal thoughts and urges. When I noticed they weren't going away, I decided to tell my doctor. She started me out on 5mg Trubtellix a day for one week, then upped it to 10mg. I started having headaches at the 10mg, but I refused to give up. About three weeks later, I really noticed it working and the headaches had gone away. I'm glad I stuck with it! I was a little unsure about the fact that I only needed 10mg of it, but it works. No more "bad thoughts"

Today the 14 Nov 2019 is my SILVER Wedding anniversary. I have had this drug since Nov 2018. First 6-7 months had 5 mg and upped to 10mg. Good effect on my depression at 5 mg.
